I started playing around with Trikki Rikki's txt and noticed that you can lay the sequences in a way that makes an even longer sequence. Starting to get some very long sequences.
I also noted down some 'special sequences', e.g. 1a and 1b is the same book, but one sequence within has another starting point - so the books can be rearranged to match eachother 1:1.
I also added brackets around sequences [number] to keep track of sequences within that match with other books, or can be rearranged to match other books 1:1.
At this point, all books are original. Some have been split which is marked with '+' signs, but no book is rearranged.

+++ = spaces added


    21972789431519118519118018944521972
57652197278943151911851911801894452197278894383435081243485
       72789431519118519118018944521972788943834350812434856114519121670467261145800369042204648451911452197271288952195945765128895003621512889521961
                                            383435081243485611451912167046726114580036904220464845191145219727128895219594576512889500362151288952196114364585611451904509118003158604215857651288724348561145196726114519 -- 6b
                                                                                                               94576512889506512889500362151288952196114364585611451904509118003150362151288952196114364585611451904509118003159457 -- 6a special start end, multiple duplicates within itself
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 9746483494727830404215857659434421595604218302031180657191894345219911843508124348561145191211288830464679727831601343545219721277709096734709201285719

9727816705121648561145191991
1457278572611857643646724353452756019288952
6889521991180065128
1973536467249684756019968477090889521

+ these 2 books are scrambled but almost identical
094343508434856118003641973536467249684756019968477090889521688952199118006512814572785726118576436467243534527560192889529727816705121648561145191991
      50843485611457278572611857643646724353452756019288952197353646724968475601996847709088952197278167051216485611451919911800364688952199118006512889523646721191180035765135347830

+ can be turned into e.g. this by removing same sequences from both books, meaning, they are almost identical but scrambled
094343508434856119735364672496847560199684770908895216889521991180065128
      50843485611973536467249684756019968477090889521688952199118006512889523646721191180035765135347830

   40421585765121615180094343508434856114572785726118576436467243534527560192889521973536467249684756019968477090889521972781670512164856114519199118003646889521991180065128 -- 3a

   094343508434856118003641973536467249684756019968477090889521688952199118006512814572785726118576436467243534527560192889529727816705121648561145191991 -- 3b
